review.title: Tacit knowledge mining algorithm based on linguistic truth-valued concept lattice
review.abstract: This paper is the continuation of our research work about linguistic truth-valued concept lattice. In order to provide a mathematical tool for mining tacit knowledge, we establish a concrete model of 6-ary linguistic truth-valued concept lattice and introduce a mining algorithm through the structure consistency. Specifically, we utilize the attributes to depict knowledge, propose the 6-ary linguistic truth-valued attribute extended context and congener context to characterize tacit knowledge, and research the necessary and sufficient conditions of forming tacit knowledge. We respectively give the algorithms of generating the linguistic truth-valued congener context and constructing the linguistic truth-valued concept lattice.

sections.heading: 3. Linguistic truth-valued concept lattice
sections.text: In this section, we will examine the definitions and theorems of the linguistic concept of truth "lattice" and give an example to illustrate it.Definition 3.1 [16] Denote MT = {True (Tr for short), False (Fa for short)}, which is called a set of meta-truth values. An LIA defined on the basis of meta-truth values is called a meta-linguistic truth assessment LIA, where Fa < Tr, the operation is called Tr '= Fa and Fa'.

sections.heading: 4. Tacit knowledge mining algorithm based on linguistic truth-valued concept lattice
sections.text: In the pioneering work on methods of extracting tacit knowledge, many researchers place the emphasis on interview and observation, and in the entire process of tacit knowledge acquisition, accuracy and timeliness cannot be guaranteed. So far, there are only a few studies to establish a mathematical model for tacit knowledge. Taking into account the importance of tacit knowledge, in this section we will create a concrete mathematical model and explore the relevant theories.

sections.heading: 4.1 Tacit knowledge mining theory of linguistic truth-valued concept lattice

sections.heading: 5. Conclusions
sections.text: As a theoretical premise of effective tacit knowledge in mining, our research on the model construction of a 6-way linguistic, truth-weighted concept grid is helpful in providing a useful mathematical tool. Based on the definitions of attribute-extended context and coherent context, this essay examines the necessary and sufficient conditions for the generation of tacit knowledge, and under this condition we can obtain the immutable structure of linguistic truth-weighted concept grid. Algorithms for generating a linguistic, truth-weighted context and establishing linguistic, truth-weighted concept grid based on these conditions are proposed.

referenceMentions.context: According to Parsaye [1], there are three major approaches to capture the tacit knowledge from groups and individuals: (i) Interviewing experts: structured interviewing of experts in a particular subject is the most commonly used technique to capture pertinent, tacit knowledge; (ii) Learning by being told: this can be done by interviewing or by task analysis.
